Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: acarballop
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and big, the hotel staff were helpful and the location was fine. It is a little bit far from Madrid downtown but there is a metro station close to the hotel and it takes like 10 minutes to get to the heart of Madrid. The breakfast buffet was really great. I think this is a good option so you don't need to pay more for being closer to the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close the airport”
Reviews.Author: April M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my last night in Europe. What a wonderful way to end my trip. The hotel is close to the airport and within a short walking distance to the metro. The hotel staff were very friendly and helped me out a great deal with directions to several points of interest. The rooms were clean and the beds did a fine job. I even got a laugh from the a la carte pillow pamphlet. Our room faced an open parking lot which was fine because our main purpose of the hotel was to sleep. Free internet access is available in the lobby. Overall I was pleasantly surprised with the price we paid to stay at the Velada Madrid Hotel. We had stayed at a dive in Malaga and paid the same price!! I would recommend the Velada Madrid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TolgaOn
Reviews.Content: These hotel is a business hotel. Location is on a business street, I recommend this hotel, it is clean and service is fine and close to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Julie U
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before the Madrid Marathon and had a really great experience because of the willingness of the hotel staff to give us information on the city, the cleanliness of the room, and the proximity to the metro. We chose the hotel because of the price and were very surprised for what we got out of it in comparison to what we've paid in similar amounts with many less amenities. Would recommend this hotel to someone who wants a good value, and who isn't afraid of using the metro or walking to get around town rather than being in the heart of town. Also liked the absolutely free airport shuttle, which we've found some hotels advertise an airport shuttle, but still charge a high fee for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 out of 5. But a bit better than 3”
Reviews.Author: ShugsyLondon
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times on business. Service is pretty good and the rooms and hotel in general are spotlessly clean. It just lacks a bit of soul and any uniqueness and the rooms are pretty dreary for hanging out in. Very near to the airport but a little way from the city centre. I would not stay here for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: BaskersonTour
Reviews.Content: Velada is a good very reasonably priced hotel close to the centre of madrid and only 11 euro in a taxi from the airport. rooms are fine and the staff speak good english....the breakfast is ok as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Running_Bird
Reviews.Content: The rooms are relatively spacious and well-maintained. The hotel is in a bland industrial/business district, but close to 2 metro stops (same line). Breakfast is average, and the hotel "cafeteria" has a very limited menu. Not many good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are flying from Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MCB21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well appointed, with quiet, clean, spacious bedrooms. The shower in our room (143) was good and we also had a jacuzzi bath. The free wireless internet worked well and was easy to connect to. The breakfast buffet catered for every taste and offered a wide range of options but is perhaps a little overpriced at 15 euros. We didn't try out any of the channels on the TV, but I was surprised that it wasnt a flat screen. The big advantage for us was the free shuttle bus which took us to Madrid Barajas airport within 15-20 minutes. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marko-Caco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge, and is located some 20-25 minutes direct metro line from the city center (Plaza Espana, Callao etc). The breakfast is excellent, of course, the coffee sucks, but the bar is next door. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and clean. The TV should be flat screen and should offer wider range of TV channels from Europe, and rest of the World. Internet works well, shower is great but as in many other hotels, shampoo and shower gel are not very inspiring. If you arrive late in the evening there is a shop+restaurant just next door open until 1 AM. All in all, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located for Airport and City”
Reviews.Author: cafc1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as a recommendation from a colleague. Personally it suited me as the hotel is located 5 minutes walk from our office. I must say that this is a fine hotel, it is clean, the staff are pleasant and has the added bonus of a free shuttle service to the airport (10-15 minutes drive) that runs throughout the day and can be booked at reception. The breakfast at the hotel (€15) has a fine selection of food that will satisfy all tastes. There is also a cafe adjacent tto the reception that does light snacks Rooms are cleaned daily by friendly staff. It is a short walk to the nearest metro station, line 5, which has a direct 20 minute link to the city centre (€1 for a single trip). There are plenty of local shops, bars, cafe's and supermarkets directly outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel... not a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Awe100
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 5 or 6 times whilst visiting madrid on business, as this is a shot walk into the office. It's a very clean, functional hotel, there is also free wifi in the rooms and in the recption area/. The bedrooms are a little dated, some of the beds are not the best. The Breakfast in the bar is very limited and the buffet breakfast if not included in the room rate, is expensive for what it has to offer. There isn't much food or drink wise close to the office but you are only a short walk to the nearest metro station and 20 mins on the metro from some of the more interesting areas. But on the whole it's an ok hotel if you need to stay in this area, the reception are all very polite, helpful and speak good English (if you need them to).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value for price, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Tengeresz
Reviews.Content: We have spent few days in Madrid and this hotel was recommended by friends that it is near to the airport, has good value for its low price. The hotel is in a 20 minutes bus ride from the Barajas, easy to find. The building is compact, the entrance is near to the steet and the bus stop, thus the traffic was quite noticable in the room. The bathroom has space, was clean and as expected. Intresting that the towels were changed even if kept on the hanger. The TV is old and small, WiFi is not free, channels are spanish, but BBC and CNN. I did not use payTV neither the minibar. Bed linen was not perfect, but acceptable. AC was strong to keep up with the 38 degree, the window had view to the street. We did not have breakfast, but coffee in the cafe, which was OK. Reception and cleaning staff were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: maridomi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel more than 20 times in the last 8 years, always for business reason's. This hotel has never disappointed me, as it meets almost all execpations of a business traveller. I would not choose this hotel for family or touristic trip to Madrid. Positive points : modern hotel, spacious room, good service in the room, excellent restaurant, very nice bar, quiet, 15 min from airport Points to be improved : very impersonal breakfast room, far from city center (but metro is close by), internet connection never easy (they recently installed wireless connections, but was not working in my room during my last stay),

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to visit Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Federico S
Reviews.Content: Good: cleanliness, espacious rooms, in-room wifi, several local cafes nearby, metro station in 5 minutes walk, good value.... Bad: bit far from the centre although metro is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bit far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: SpacemanSpiff77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business training. Teh room was good, nice bathroom and good bed. Breakfast can be had in the cafe (cheap, basic but okay), or in the huge breakfast room (expensive). Latter is great, lots offered. Service is great, staff is very helpful. Cafe is nice, friendly staff here as well. Basic food there, but okay. Lunches offered during the training were good. It's a bit far (20 -30 min by metro) from the centre but in a safe feeling area.

Reviews.Title: “hotel dangereux”
Reviews.Author: wzzhao
Reviews.Content: There is a big security problem in the hotel Velada On July 04 2010, I was robbed in the hall of this hotel in front of tens of people (claimed in police station San Blas-Vicalvaro). I was astonished by danger that I met in your hall and I’ll never come back to your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard tourist hotel where they don't expect you to return”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located outside the centre of Madrid and, although it is within 5 minutes of an underground station, it takes a good half hour to get into town. It's also quite difficult to get to the conference centre using public transport and so I would say it's not well located for either. The rooms are adequate and reasonably spacious. Bathroom is ok. The food and the ambience are pretty dire and it seems to cater for bus loads of tourists. I wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: dukems
Reviews.Content: Large clean room with modern bathroom. Reception spoke English and was helpful. Free computer with internet access in lobby. Free room safe. Metro entrance less than 5 minute walk from hotel. About 20 to 30 minutes on Metro to get to central Madrid with one change required. I traveled from airport (T4) to hotel on Metro. Required 3 changes. Hotel located on mixed residential and commercial strip. I felt safe walking back to hotel at night (8 PM).

Reviews.Title: “Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: Wicklowman53
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for 3 nights, but I stayed one night before this in a hostel, just to see the difference. And, my God, I was glad with the change. The hostal in calle de Atocha (centre of Madrid) was so basic: the room was the size of two single beds, just enough room to get changed and get into bed. My transfer to Velada Hotel was like winning the Lottery: big room, great bathroom with big shower and toiletries included (lovely white clean towels, I still remember the smell of the little towel they gave me in the hostal). The breakfast was superb (buffet breakfast - some websites called it Continental, but it was full buffet for everyone) You could eat so much that you wouldn't need lunch. And the swimming pool and sauna was a plus. 5 minutes walk to Ciudad Lineal metro station, and 15 minutes ride to Gran Via, worth the €6 difference in the price... YES six euro. Avoid Hostels in Madrid, especially when you can get a four star Hotel like this, breakfast included, for a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomasbg
Reviews.Content: Good location, 20-30 minutes from the city center, 1 hour from the airport, well connected with the Metro network. Nice and spacious rooms, free wireless internet in the public areas, clean and well serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor crisis management, watch your belongings”
Reviews.Author: Chilli_tourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the hotel with my family. At first, I thought it was very good - nice bedrooms, good breakfast, clean overall ambience. My mother has glaucoma and needs to have her medication daily in order to keep it under control. When we got back from the street to the hotel, her medication had disappeared from the counter where she left it. Besides being expensive, her medication had been formulated in our home town. There was no way we could get it re-formulated in two days. When we told the person in charge at the reception that the medication had disappeared, she plainly stated "that does not happen around here". I must be a clown, then. Apparently, a client's word is not worth much at Velada's. Instead of trying to solve the situation or talking to the maids, she handed us some forms to fill, which we should deliver to Madrid authorities. What she didn't understand was that I was leaving the next day and simply did not have the time to stop my family's tour and head to some government department to handle a form that I doubt will be read. Later on, I discovered a few suitcases from my travel group were opened while we were out. Although we did not miss anything except my mother's medication, it gave us a feeling of insecurity and dishonesty about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonntags
Reviews.Content: You cannot expect too much from a hotel located in industrial area, but one is very nice and has the advantage of being situated in the Alacalá Street which gives you a bit more dining and night-life options than the other hotels in this area. Rooms are huge and nicely decorated, everything was OK and the breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good - lacks a little atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: PCagney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions over the summer and it is fine for business travel. It is clean has good facilities and services and the hotel staff speak reasonable English. They appear to do a roaring trade in Bus tours and the noise from these guests can sometimes be annoying and when they are checking in and out the lobby is chaos. The location is desirable for the Feria and the Airport but is a 15 to 20 min trip on the metro to the city centre. There is a few restaurants around but for tourists a location nearer the city centre might be preferable.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyashish
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Velada several times this year. This is manily a business hotel, but can be used as a cheaper tourist hotel since it is walking distance to the metro that will take you to the city center (15 mins). Pros: Good business hotel: fast internet connection, 2 english movies on PPV, clean lobby and coffee bar. Across the street from VIPS (TGI Fridays like dining option for continental food). Cost value ratio is good. Cons: Rooms are old and dirty looking - they desperately need an upgrade, breakfast is ok.

HotelInfo.Name: Velada Madrid Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Alcala 476, 28027 Madrid, Spain
